    SSM_vignette data exploration via KFAS Sample data

Sample data

Source: vignettes/sample_data.Rmd
sample_data.Rmd

Introduction

This document provided the explicit data generation process for the sample data. The sample data sets are generated by function sim_y_x_single_c We will specify the data generation process under different parametric settings. We will have an outcome y, a treatment x(ususally continous), a covariate c. We will provide different scenarios:

To load example data set, use the following code:

ssmimputedemo::data_stationary

Time-invariant coefficients

data_stationary: We have \(C_t\) and \(X_t\) both follows AR(1) process For each time point, \[ \begin{aligned} &C_t = 0.25C_{t-1}+5+w_{C,t}, w_{C,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\\ &X_t =0.5X_{t-1}+5+w_{X,t}, w_{X,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\ \end{aligned} \] and the outcome follows: \[ Y_t = 40+0.5Y_{t-1}-1.5X_t-0.5X_{t-1}-C_t+w_t, w_t \sim \text{i.i.d }\mathcal{N}(0,1) \]

par(mfrow=c(3,1))
plot(ts(data$c), main = "c")
plot(ts(data$x), main = "x")
plot(ts(data$y), main = "y")

AR(1) coefficients for covariate

data_AR1: For each time point, \[ \begin{aligned} &C_t = 0.25C_{t-1}+5+w_{C,t}, w_{C,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\\ &X_t =0.5X_{t-1}+5+w_{X,t}, w_{X,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\ \end{aligned} \]

For outcome: \[ Y_t = 40+0.5Y_{t-1}-1.5X_t-0.5X_{t-1}-\beta_{C,t}C_t+v_t, v_t \sim \text{i.i.d }\mathcal{N}(0,1) \] Here \(\beta_{C,t}\) follows an AR(1) process \[ \beta_{C,t} =0.5 \beta_{C,t-1}-1+w_{\beta,t}, w_{\beta,t}\sim \mathcal{N}(0,0.1) \]

par(mfrow=c(3,1))
plot(ts(data$c), main = "c")
plot(ts(data$x), main = "x")
plot(ts(data$y), main = "y")

Random walk coefficients

data_randomwalk: For each time point, \[ \begin{aligned} &C_t = 0.25C_{t-1}+5+w_{C,t}, w_{C,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\\ &X_t =0.5X_{t-1}+5+w_{X,t}, w_{X,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\ \end{aligned} \]

For outcome: \[ Y_t = 40+0.5Y_{t-1}-1.5X_t-0.5X_{t-1}-\beta_{C,t}C_t+v_t, v_t \sim \text{i.i.d }\mathcal{N}(0,1) \] Here \(\beta_{C,t}\) follows a random walk process: \[ \beta_{C,t} =\beta_{C,t-1}+1.5+w_{\beta,t}, w_{\beta,t}\sim \mathcal{N}(0,0.05) \]

par(mfrow=c(3,1))
plot(ts(data$c), main = "c")
plot(ts(data$x), main = "x")
plot(ts(data$y), main = "y")

Periodic stable

data_periodic: For each time point, \[ \begin{aligned} &C_t = 0.25C_{t-1}+5+w_{C,t}, w_{C,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\\ &X_t =0.5X_{t-1}+5+w_{X,t}, w_{X,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\ \end{aligned} \]

For outcome: \[ Y_t = 40+0.5Y_{t-1}-\beta_{1,t}X_t-\beta_{2,t}X_{t-1}-C_t+v_t, v_t \sim \text{i.i.d }\mathcal{N}(0,1) \] Here \(\beta_{1,t},\beta_{2,t}\) follows a periodic stable: \[ \begin{aligned} \beta_{1,t}&= -1.5,\beta_{2,t}= -0.5, \text{when } t \in [0, 500]\\ \beta_{1,t}&= -2.5,\beta_{2,t}= -1, \text{when } t \in (500, 800]\\ \beta_{1,t}&= -1.5,\beta_{2,t}= -0.5, \text{when } t \in (800, 1100]\\ \end{aligned} \]

\[ \beta_{C,t} =\beta_{C,t-1}+1.5+w_{\beta,t}, w_{\beta,t}\sim \mathcal{N}(0,0.05) \]

Random walk baseline and several periods of fixed coefficients, under a more complex setting

data_complex: For each time point, \[ \begin{aligned} &C_t = 0.25C_{t-1}+5+w_{C,t}, w_{C,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\\ &X_t =0.5X_{t-1}+5+w_{X,t}, w_{X,t} \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1)\ \end{aligned} \]

For outcome, \[ Y_t = \beta_{0,t}+0.5Y_{t-1}-\beta_{1,t}X_t-0.5X_{t-1}-C_t+v_t, v_t \sim \text{i.i.d }\mathcal{N}(0,1) \] It has a random walk baseline, \(\beta_{1,t}\) follows periodic stable: \[ \begin{aligned} \beta_{1,t}&= -1.5,\text{when } t \in [0, 500]\\ \beta_{1,t}&= -2.5, \text{when } t \in (500, 800]\\ \beta_{1,t}&= -1.5, \text{when } t \in (800, 1100]\\ \beta_{0,t}&= \beta_{0,t-1}+40+w_t, w_t \sim \mathcal{N}(0,0.25) \end{aligned} \]

par(mfrow=c(3,1))
plot(ts(data$c), main = "c")
plot(ts(data$x), main = "x")
plot(ts(data$y), main = "y")
